content.description:
Similar to Arm and Hammer. Short slab to bolt. Through crack with a few places for gear. Do a few face moves left to anchor and there you go.  

  If you lap this route and its neighbor you can kinda get a decent work out in when your burnt out on the other areas;) 

  Usually needs vegetation cleaned out after months/years of inactivity.

Short but interesting. Climb easy slab to boulder problem crux. I installed a two bolt anchor at the top that is between this route and Beetle of the Bulge. The two routes are close enough together that sharing an anchor seemed reasonable. 

  I usually had to clean out vegetation each spring before I climbed this route. Not a lot, but its much more enjoyable when its been cleaned. Then again, who else is really going to climb this... ;) 

  I climbed in this area for 7 years and almost never saw another party... Go figure.

Small bay just past Wailing wall. This is just past Wailing Wall and before Lower Flailing Wall. Arm and Hammer and Beetle of the Bulge are fun little boulder problems. I was never able to find Manly Bulge or Macho Do About Nothing, perhaps their there but they don't look very interesting. The rock looks less than great and when the rock isn't good in the Grand Canyon your better off going for a hike and enjoying the sunset than trying to play on 40 feet of choss. Choss being a very relative term in the GC. 

  Once again, these routes are found in Green's Falcon guide.
